content: Define the module TopModule with the specified input and output ports: input mode, input too_cold, input too_hot, input fan_on, output heater, output aircon, and output fan.
source: I would like you to implement a module named TopModule with the following interface. All input and output ports are one bit unless otherwise specified.

content: Implement the logic for the heater output. In heating mode (mode = 1), turn the heater on when it is too cold (too_cold = 1).
source: In heating mode, turn the heater on when it is too cold (too_cold = 1) but do not use the air conditioner.

content: Implement the logic for the aircon output. In cooling mode (mode = 0), turn the air conditioner on when it is too hot (too_hot = 1).
source: In cooling mode, turn the air conditioner on when it is too hot (too_hot = 1), but do not turn on the heater.

content: Implement the logic for the fan output. Turn on the fan when either the heater or air conditioner is on, or when the fan_on input is 1.
source: When the heater or air conditioner are on, also turn on the fan to circulate the air. In addition, the user can also request the fan to turn on (fan_on = 1), even if the heater and air conditioner are off.
